info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 25 at 8:04PM CDT until May 27 at 4:21PM CDT by NWS Fort Worth TX
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Fort Worth TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas...
Denton Creek Near Justin affecting Denton County.
Trinity River At Dallas affecting Dallas County.
White Rock Creek Near White Rock Creek At Greenville Ave affecting Dallas County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Trinity River at Dallas.
* WHEN...From Monday afternoon to Tuesday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 30.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding will begin. The pasture lands near the river will flood. Trails along the river begin to flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 22.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 30.0 feet. - Flood stage is 30.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 30.9 feet late tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Tuesday morning.
info.instruction:
Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at www.water.noaa.gov/wfo/FWD.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON TO TUESDAY AFTERNOON
